    10→APM; V8.1.3; V8.1.4; keystore; truststore; files; expired; expiring; upgrading; apmui; oidc; directory; certificate; server; installation TECHNOTE (TROUBLESHOOTING)
    11→
    12→PROBLEM(ABSTRACT)
    13→ The APM V8.1.3 default certificate that is provided for the OIDC service is set to expire 2 years after the APM V8.1.3 server is installed. APM V8.1.3 was released (GA'd) on the 1st of May, 2016. This 2 year time frame is expiring now or very soon for customers who installed APM V8.1.3 at the time it was released (GA'd) or soon after it released, and have not either configured custom certificates or upgraded to APM V8.1.4.
    14→
    15→The APM V8.1.3 APMUI default certificate is hardcoded to expire on the 21st of April, 2019.
    16→
    17→SYMPTOM
    18→How will I know if the OIDC certificate has expired?
    19→
    20→When the OIDC certificate has expired, users will receive a "Secure Connection Failed" message in their browser instead of the APM 8.1.3 Login Page.
    21→
    22→How will I know if the APMUI certificate has expired?
    23→
    24→When the APMUI certificate has expired, users will receive a "Your connection is not secure" message that indicates the APM UI certificate has expired when navigating to APM server port 9443.
    25→
    26→RESOLVING THE PROBLEM
    27→To maintain valid UI certificates for installations that are still using the default out-of-the-box certificates, the existing keystore files must be replaced with the keystore files that are attached at the end of this technote.
    28→
    29→The following new keystore files that are attached to this technote contain certificates that expire in 2028.
    30→
    31→1. updated.8.1.3.oidc.key.jks (password: ccmR0cKs!)
    32→2. updated.8.1.3.apmui.key.jks (password: apmpass)
    33→3. updated.8.1.3.trust.jks (password: ccmR0cKs!)

    42→ * Valid for a two year period.
    43→ * Signature Algorithm is SHA256withRSA.
    44→ * Owner: CN=localhost, O=IBM, OU=oidc, C=US and Issuer: CN=localhost, O=IBM, OU=oidc, C=US

    50→1.2. List the certificates in the key store by issuing the following command:

   177→Procedures
   178→
   179→Installation procedure (using /opt/ibm as the install directory)
   180→
   181→1. Download the new keystore files attached at the end of this technote into a temporary directory (/ tmp) on the APM server.
   182→
   183→2. Stop APM by issuing the following command:
   184→
   185→apm stop_all
   186→
   187→3. Back up the existing OIDC keystore by issuing the following command:

   191→4. Install the new OIDC keystore (replace the existing file) by issuing the following command:

   194→

   198→

   200→
   201→cp /tmp/updated.8.1.3.apmui.key.jks /opt/ibm/wlp/usr/servers/apmui/resources/security/key.jks
   202→

   206→
   207→8. Install the new UI truststore (replace the existing file) by issuing the following command:
   208→
   209→cp /tmp/updated.8.1.3.trust.jks /opt/ibm/wlp/usr/shared/resources/security/trust.jks
   210→
   211→9. Restart APM by issuing the following command:
   212→
   213→apm start_all

   216→

   218→

     9→
    10→5724G70UITR TECHNOTE (FAQ)
    11→
    12→QUESTION
    13→ Which roles must a user have to integrate APMUI console in DASH?
    14→
    15→CAUSE
    16→The DASH admin user may be defined on a different user repository from the APMUI user registry. For APMUI console integration to succeed, the DASH admin user must be defined in a common user repository for both APMUI and DASH servers.
    17→
    18→ANSWER
    19→Below steps can be used to give administrative roles to a user from the APMUI user registry, and then log into DASH as this user to perform the console integration steps.
    20→
    21→1) Define user repository of APMUI in DASH.
    22→2) Identify a user from APMUI user repository to be granted admin role in DASH (the example below uses apmadmin user)
    23→3) Follow these steps to assign admin roles to the user:
    24→
    25→3.1 Log into DASH as a user with administrator privileges, select Console Settings->User Roles option.
    26→
    27→[/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21903489&aid=1] [/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21903489&aid=1]
    28→
    29→3.2 On the User Roles page, type the ID of APMUI user (for example, apmadmin) and then click the "Search" button. Click the link for the user in returned search results.
    30→
    31→[/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21903489&aid=2] [/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21903489&aid=2]
    32→
    33→3.3 Select the "administrator" and "iscadmins" roles and then click "Save".
    34→
    35→[/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21903489&aid=3] [/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21903489&aid=3]
    36→
    37→4) Use this administrative user to perform console integration steps.
    38→
    39→RELATED INFORMATION

query:
Traffic across domains seems unexpected 

I have two Multi-Protocol Gateways (MPGWs) configured, each in their own domain:

     Domain A
     MPGW_A
     FSH_A (1.2.3.4:443)
     Domain B
     MPGW_B
     FSH_B (0.0.0.0:443)

The FSH_B is disabled, thus MPGW_B cannot take traffic. However, if I modify the config for MPGW_B (i.e. just change a Stylesheet parameter) the traffic goes to MPGW_B somehow. How is this happening? FSH_B is still disabled.

    34→ERROR DESCRIPTION
    35→ *  Affected are customers sending HTTP GET requests to the
    36→   multiprotocol gateway, web service proxy or web application
    37→   firewall service.
    38→
    39→   With the present implementation, users may end up in a state
    40→   with indefinite retries for HTTP GET requests as long as
    41→   DataPower has at least one live persistent connection to the
    42→   backend server. After timeout interval for active connection it
    43→   will terminate the connection and retry using remaining
    44→   persistent connections to the backend. (If a new connection is
    45→   opened because of half-dead backend this can continue
    46→   indefinitely or until the request is served).
    47→
    48→
    49→
    50→
    51→
    52→
    53→LOCAL FIX
    54→ *  This behavior cannot be turned off however it can be mitigated.
    55→   For some relief out of this, the admin can lower the Back
    56→   Persistent Timeout and/or User Agent's default Timeout. This
    57→   should result in less persistent connections to the backend and
    58→   thus less possible timeout hops
    59→
    60→   Dropping the backend persistent connections option is also a
    61→   possible workaround, but the consequences should be weighed
    62→   carefully before making this decision. Not using persistent
    63→   connections comes with a performance penalty, but it very much
    64→   depends on the size/type of the transferred data and the
    65→   speed/ping of the network.
    66→
    67→   SLM is also strongly encouraged to prevent the backend from
    68→   getting more load than it can handle.
    69→
    70→
    71→
    72→
    73→
    74→
    75→PROBLEM SUMMARY
    76→ *  Affected are all customers using the Multi-Protocol Gateway,
    77→   Web Service Proxy or Web Application Firewall with persistent
    78→   connection to the backend side.
    79→
    80→   In case the backend server stops responding to HTTP GET
    81→   requests while there are already some established TCP
    82→   connections from the time the server worked OK, DataPower will
    83→   automatically retry those GET requests after a timeout period.
    84→   This will be retried until there are no established connections
    85→   to the server.
    86→
    87→   During a high load window, these unwanted retries might
    88→   eventually keep flooding an already congested backend,
    89→   especially if it is still able to establish some new
    90→   connections.

    92→
    93→
    94→

[ToolResultBlock(tool_use_id='tooluse_m7ZfWWGR8cp5oNh2tZKffq', content='     1→---
     2→id: "6b083006"
     3→title: "Forward Proxy XMLFW MPGW CONNECT TUNNEL TECHNOTE (TROUBLESHOOTING)"
     4→source_repo: "rungalileo/ragbench"
     5→source_path: "techqa/test/48/doc_4"
     6→tags: [ragbench, techqa]
     7→confidence: medium
     8→---
     9→
    10→Forward Proxy XMLFW MPGW CONNECT TUNNEL TECHNOTE (TROUBLESHOOTING)
    11→
    12→PROBLEM(ABSTRACT)
    13→ How to configure an IBM WebSphere DataPower SOA Appliance Service to proxy an SSL request to a remote proxy server using the CONNECT method for SSL tunneling?
    14→
    15→CAUSE
    16→Many common forward proxy servers expect requests in different formats depending on if they are proxying non-SSL or SSL requests.
    17→
    18→For example, a non-SSL request to be proxied may come in the form of GET hostname:port/URI.
    19→
    20→For SSL requests to be proxied, remote proxy servers are commonly configured to tunnel the request from the client to the backend server.
    21→
    22→In the SSL request scenario, remote proxy servers will typically expect a CONNECT request and then tunnel the SSL request from the client to the backend server.
    23→
    24→Users configuring DataPower may need a way to implement this CONNECT method for SSL tunneling to a remote Proxy Server.
    25→
    26→RESOLVING THE PROBLEM
    27→Non-SSL Proxy requests will work using either:
    28→
    29→a) an XML Firewall when configuring in the HTTP Options tab, where the user can configure the Proxy Host and Port
    30→
    31→b) a Multi-Protocol Gateway when configuring an HTTP Proxy Policy in the User Agent
    32→
    33→SSL Proxy requests will work using the CONNECT method for SSL Tunneling when using a Multi-Protocol Gateway when configuring in a User Agent's HTTP Proxy Policy.
    34→
    35→The XML Firewall service is not designed to use the CONNECT method for SSL Tunneling.

[ToolResultBlock(tool_use_id='tooluse_TKaV4eUlY7uNItGHQbv5pL', content='     1→---
     2→id: "ba7b5156"
     3→title: "TECHNOTE (TROUBLESHOOTING)"
     4→source_repo: "rungalileo/ragbench"
     5→source_path: "techqa/test/10/doc_1"
     6→tags: [ragbench, techqa]
     7→confidence: medium
     8→---
     9→
    10→TECHNOTE (TROUBLESHOOTING)
    11→
    12→PROBLEM(ABSTRACT)
    13→ When to enable Sharing Conversations in DataPower MQ Queue Manager (mq-qm) object along with SHARECNV attribute of the MQ SVRCONN channel?
    14→
    15→RESOLVING THE PROBLEM
    16→IBM WebSphere MQ server version 7.0 and later releases provide sharing conversations (SHARECNV) attribute on SVRCONN channel that specifies the maximum number of conversations that can share each TCP/IP channel instance. This feature can be configured in DataPower as it uses client connection with queue manager SVRCONN channel.
    17→The default setting of sharing conversations (SHARECNV) value is zero in DataPower mq-qm object. The same default value for MQ SVRCONN channel is 10. The sharing conversations value is
    18→negotiated between MQ server and DataPower and the lower value takes effect. However, in current versions of the DataPower firmware, the sharing conversations setting of 1 is treated as 0 when negotiating with MQ server.
    19→
    20→There are three use cases to configure Sharing Conversations in DataPower mq-qm object:
    21→
    22→Case #1 : The negotiated sharing conversations value is 0 - The channel runs in a mode similar to WebSphere MQ V6 and does not uses features such as
    23→
    24→· Administrator stop-quiesce
    25→· Heartbeating
    26→· Read ahead
    27→· Client asynchronous consume
    28→
    29→Set a value of 0 or 1 on the Sharing Conversations attribute of the mq-qm object in DataPower to disable sharing conversations regardless of the IBM WebSphere MQ SVRCONN setting.
    30→
    31→Case #2: The negotiated sharing conversations value is 1 - The channel supports IBM WebSphere MQ V7 and later release features as outlined in case #1, but each TCP/IP channel instance has a single conversation.
    32→
    33→Set a value of 1 on the Sharing Conversations attribute and select "on" in Share Single Conversation attribute of the mq-qm object in DataPower as shown in the following picture and a value of 1 on IBM WebSphere MQ SVRCONN setting.
    34→
    35→The Share Single Conversation attribute is only visible when "Sharing Conversations" is configured with value of "1" and then <RETURN> key is entered. For values greater than 1, the "Share Single Conversation" attribute is hidden in the mq-qm object.
    36→[/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21647231&aid=1] [/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21647231&aid=1]
    37→
    38→Case #3: The negotiated sharing conversations value is 2 or more - The channel supports IBM WebSphere MQ 7 and later release features and each TCP/IP channel instance supports 2 or more conversations.
    39→
    40→Set a value of 2 or more on the Sharing Conversations attribute of the mq-qm object in DataPower and on the MQ SVRCONN channel.
    41→
    42→On average, processing of messages from client applications is 15 percent slower when using SHARECNV(10) as compared to SHARECNV(0). Please refer to Performance Implications of Sharing [http://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSFKSJ_7.0.1/com.ibm.mq.csqzaf.doc/mi12240_.htm]
    43→Conversations on Client-connection Channels. [http://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSFKSJ_7.0.1/com.ibm.mq.csqzaf.doc/mi12240_.htm].
    44→
    45→Since DataPower uses a connection pool in processing MQ messages, there are no additional benefits of using sharing conversations with the mq-qm object. However, in situations when mixed message sizes are used by the same mq-qm object, using case #2 will benefit mq-qm object as it will use new buffer management feature of IBM WebSphere MQ Version 7 when making MQGET API call.
    46→
    47→When using a negotiated shared conversations value of 0 as in case #1, mq-qm object uses maximum message size as the buffer pool for the MQGET API call. However, when mixed message sizes are processed by the same MQ Front Side Handler (FSH), it requests buffer pool based on maximum message size configured in the mq-qm object. The use of fixed buffer pool for small and large messages can deplete MQ server's allocated buffer and contribute to unexpected termination of MQ SVRCONN channel instance and may terminate the queue manager. In such a situation, using a negotiated sharing conversations value of 1 as in case #2 will benefit DataPower mq-qm object as it will use IBM WebSphere MQ Version 7 Read Ahead feature and the new buffer management feature for MQGET API call. IBM WebSphere MQ V8 release provides enhanced performance for case #2, when the negotiated sharing conversations value is 1.
    48→
    49→For DataPower firmware releases 7.0.0.x, 7.1.0.x, 7.2.0.x and earlier, one should follow case #1 and use a negotiated sharing conversations value of 0. If you configure these firmware versions with case #2 or case #3, DataPower device may reload or hang due to connection instability and generate many MQ errors with Reason Code - 2009 and 2059.
    50→
    51→Cases #2 and #3 can be used in firmware releases 7.5.0.x, 7.5.1.x and later. We suggest to use a value of 10 or less in Sharing Conversations attribute of the mq-qm object and verify the configuration empirically to make sure that IBM WebSphere MQ server can sustain load from DataPower with the negotiated Sharing Conversations of 10.
    52→
    53→Note: In order to use sharing conversations, make sure you have applied APAR IV24821 [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg1IV24821] ("Client C application process hangs after cancelling thread") to the IBM WebSphere MQ server. IV24821 is included in IBM WebSphere MQ V7.0.1.10 and later, IBM WebSphere MQ V7.1.0.3 and later, IBM WebSphere MQ V7.5.0.1 and later, and IBM WebSphere MQ V8.
    54→
    55→In order to identify the negotiated Sharing Conversations status, the following MQ commands are used in the distributed platform.
    56→
    57→runmqsc <qmgr>
    58→display chs(CHANNEL3) maxshcnv curshcnv
    59→
    60→display chs(CHANNEL3) maxshcnv curshcnv
    61→1 : display chs(CHANNEL3) maxshcnv curshcnv
    62→AMQ8417: Display Channel Status details.
    63→CHANNEL(CHANNEL3) CHLTYPE(SVRCONN)
    64→CONNAME(9.x1.x2.x3) CURRENT
    65→STATUS(RUNNING) SUBSTATE(RECEIVE)
    66→CURSHCNV(1) MAXSHCNV(1) <---- Negotiated Sharing Conversations value of 1
    67→AMQ8417: Display Channel Status details.
    68→CHANNEL(CHANNEL3) CHLTYPE(SVRCONN)
    69→CONNAME(9.y1.y2.y31) CURRENT
    70→STATUS(RUNNING) SUBSTATE(RECEIVE)
    71→CURSHCNV(0) MAXSHCNV(0) <---- Negotiated Sharing Conversations value of 0
    72→
    73→end
    74→--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
    75→In order to identify the negotiated Sharing Conversations status, the following MQ commands are used in the z/OS System.
    76→
    77→connect to <qmgr>
    78→On z/OS system, options for issuing the commands are described at http://www-01.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSFKSJ_8.0.0/com.ibm.mq.ref.adm.doc/q085120_.htm [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSFKSJ_8.0.0/com.ibm.mq.ref.adm.doc/q085120_.htm].
    79→/+RTP8 DIS CHSTATUS(channel_name) MAXSHCNV CURSHCNV
    80→where "+RTP8" is the command prefix.

    13→You have two domains and you only want user traffic to work in one direction between the domains. How do you cross certify domains in only one direction?

    15→RESOLVING THE PROBLEM
    16→
    17→
    18→How you set up cross-certification for this depends on what you would be using it for. If you are setting this up strictly for user access, one-way cross-certification would work great. If you want to be able to replicate, it is more complicated.
    19→
    20→For example, you have two domains, Domain A and Domain B, and the goal is to allow Domain A access to Domain B, but not allow Domain B access to Domain A.

    22→To use this for user access:
    23→

    25→
    26→To also replicate:
    27→ *
    28→ * 2. On your Domain A server create a cross certificate for your Domain A organization to your Domain B organization.
    29→ * 3. On your Domain A server in the Server Document -> Security tab ->Access Server field, list your Domain A organization (for example, if your Domain A organization was /notes, the entry in this field would be */notes) . Also list the Domain B server's name (for example, if this is Server1/notes2, the entry in this field is Server1/notes2).

[ToolResultBlock(tool_use_id='tooluse_rwi4STcvHf9JS3JtGhIdIj', content='     1→---
     2→id: "b35766e5"
     3→title: "datapower; routing; route; default; static; gateway; default gateway; static rou"
     4→source_repo: "rungalileo/ragbench"
     5→source_path: "techqa/test/9/doc_0"
     6→tags: [ragbench, techqa]
     7→confidence: medium
     8→---
     9→
    10→datapower; routing; route; default; static; gateway; default gateway; static route TECHNOTE (TROUBLESHOOTING)
    11→
    12→PROBLEM(ABSTRACT)
    13→ The default route and static routes on the DataPower appliance have different functionality and behavior.
    14→
    15→RESOLVING THE PROBLEM
    16→A static route forces the DataPower appliance to use a specific interface and a specific set of network hops to access a given set of destinations. The "default route" is created by setting the Default Gateway of an interface on a DataPower appliance.
    17→
    18→A default route will be used if a known route does not exist for a given destination address. If multiple default routes are configured, the appliance will randomly pick which interface to use for outbound traffic if a more specific route cannot be found.
    19→
    20→If you want your network traffic to follow a specific route, set a static route and NOT rely on the default gateway. As a general rule, the management interface should not have the default gateway set, as you generally want to restrict the connections that can be made through that interface.
    21→
    22→A general recommendation is to set specific static routes and only ONE default gateway that will catch all traffic not being directed by the static routes.
    23→
    24→Consider the following example after running this command from the CLI:
    25→
    26→xs40# show route
    27→
    28→destination interface gateway metric 0.0.0.0/0 eth0 167.91.8.1 0 0.0.0.0/0 eth1 167.91.7.1 0 0.0.0.0/0 mgt0 10.238.77.1 0 10.238.77.0/24 mgt0 [/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21249208&aid=1] 0 167.81.18.0/23 eth0 [/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21249208&aid=1] 0 167.81.18.0/23 eth1 [/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21249208&aid=1] 0
    29→
    30→The output above shows that three default gateways were configured on eth0, eth1, and mgt0 which causes three "default" route to be generated (0.0.0.0/0). If the destination address of your service is 166.84.23.4, the device will randomly choose any one of the default routes as no specific route is configured. If, for example, the gateway picked is 10.238.77.1 and the gateway does not know how to route to the needed backend server ip address, this will cause unexpected connection failures. In the case of such failure, a reboot of the device will lead to a different route to be randomly picked, thus temporarily resolving until the next failure.
    31→
    32→Firmware 3.7.2 and later
    33→
    34→Instructions for setting the default gateway and for setting a static route can be found in the "Managing the appliance" section of the Administrators Guide. The command line commands are ip default-gateway and ip route respectively, and more information is available in the CLI Reference Guide.
    35→
    36→Firmware earlier than 3.7.2
    37→
    38→Instructions for setting the default gateway and static routes can be found in the "Ethernet Interface" appendix of the WebGUI Guide. The command line commands are ip default-gateway and ip route respectively, and more information is available in the CLI Reference Guide.
    39→
    40→To access product documentation, see these instructions. [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?rs=2362&uid=swg21377654]
    41→
    42→
    43→
    44→Cross reference information Segment Product Component Platform Version Edition Business Integration WebSphere DataPower Integration Appliance XI50 Not Applicable Firmware 3.8.2, 3.8.1, 3.8, 3.7.3 Business Integration WebSphere DataPower B2B Appliance XB60 Not Applicable Firmware 3.7.3 Business Integration WebSphere DataPower Low Latency Appliance XM70 Not Applicable Firmware 3.7.3 Business Integration WebSphere DataPower XML Security Gateway XS40 Not Applicable Firmware 3.8.2, 3.8.1, 3.8, 3.7.3 Business Integration WebSphere DataPower XML Accelerator XA35 Not Applicable Firmware 3.8.2, 3.8.1, 3.8, 3.7.3

    10→wste_webcast; WSTE; Support Technical Exchange; education; presentation; webcast; STEwebcastDocument; Install Manager questions to install ; uninstall ; modify ; update. WEBCAST
    11→
    12→ABSTRACT
    13→ IBM Ask the Experts discussion about WebSphere Application Server installation/uninstall/update/modify using Install Manager on 12 December 2013.
    14→This session covers install / uninstall / update / modify operations using Installation Manager on WebSphere Application Server V8.X This also covers any questions related to Install /Uninstall or applying fixpacks using Update Installer in v7.x
    15→
    16→CONTENT
    17→Ask the Experts sessions are conducted in a question and answer format.
    18→
    19→The table below provides a time index (minutes:seconds) to the recording and describes the questions or topics discussed.
    20→You can to fast forward to any question using the time index. A table containing the panel of experts is also included.
    21→
    22→To play or download the audio of this Ask the Experts session, see the Audio Section of this document (audio not available until after the webcast).
    23→
    24→See the Related Information Section of this document for a list of documents referenced during the presentation.
    25→
    26→Ask the Experts session
    27→12 December 2013 - 11:00 a.m. - 12:00 p.m. EST
    28→
    29→Time Questions asked 00:00 General introduction 02:40 Technical introduction 03:38 How can I use command line options to find what is installed and what offerings are available in the repository? 06:05 What option can I use to uninstall ifix and fixpack? 07:43 IMShared directory is using a lot of space, is there an option to delete files from this directory? 11:27 Is it possible to change AppData agent directory from default after WebSphere Application Server and other offerings are installed? 15:24 What options do I have to install Liberty 8.5.5? 17:00 Open lines for live question and answer period 17:03 On a non-administrator install, does it have to be the user_home? Can it be directed to a shared (NFS) space? 17:40 What is the difference between WAS installation through IM and Silent mode installation? 19:21 How to import license from RAD 7.0 to 8.5.5 (trial version)? 19:51 Can you please give an overview of using IM to install ifix? 20:38 I have WAS ND 8.5.5 32-bit installed on a 32-bit linux server, and I have a new linux 64bit server that we want only the 64bit 8.5.5 WAS, and use the DMGR on the 32-bit server, how do we do this? 22:14 Why is IBM only providing Installation of WebSphere Application Server through Installation Mananger? 23:01 When we go for Ifix and when we go for fixpack, what is basic difference between those? 23:50 Can you pleasee give information about what is the use of Liberty profile and its advantages? 24:57 What do you recommend if there is a need to duplicate the WebSphere environment? 26:54 What are the basic pre-req checks for installation of Installation Manager? 28:19 Do you have a link for how to federate the 64-bit WAS ND APPSERVER to 32-bit DMGR, instructions/step (jython scripting) so it can be automated? 29:20 With WebSphere products changing the method of installation, is there a white paper, or recommended practices, for setting up a central repository? 30:33 Is there any way make a WAS back-up through Installation Manager? 30:52 Do we have to uninstall previous ifix before installing latest fix pack? 32:09 We are planning to migrate from WAS 6.1 to WAS8.5.5, can I install 8.5.5 on top of the existing 6.1 profile? Or does it have to be a fresh installation? 33:10 I have an NFS share on 3 servers and IIM is installed there. Can I utilize IIM to install/uninstall with 2 different users without any issues on all 3 servers? 34:44 Is there a document for migrating WebSphere 7 to WAS 8.7 entire cell, say node-by-node? 35:11 What provisions does WebSphere Application Server provide to prevent denial of service attacks? 35:40 If we have 32-bit 8.5.5 DMGR and 1 APPSRVR 32-bit 8.5.5 and a 2nd APPSRVR 64-bit 8.5.5, does the DMGR have to be updated first or can we update the APPServers first? That is, does the order matter for fixes? 36:58 Is it a good idea to create any dependency on the dmgr for runtime? For example, Adobe Life Cycle installed on top of WAS uses some cache mechanism called gds, gemfire, etc. 37:42 I noticed on IM with 8.5 that when you choose to install the updates, it always goes through your IBM PA account to get the updates and the latest. But with Maximo application for instance, you only want to go to 8.5.0.1 for instance, so the only way I found is run the update pointing to the repository for fix 1, and choose update and keep clicking cancel to look online to continue and install the fix 1. Is this the only way to install a fix on V8 or V8.5? 39:40 When migrating WAS from 6.1 to 8.5, do you guys recommend using the migration tool or create configurations using scripts? 40:44 To upgrade websphere from 6.1 to 8.5, What path do you suggest: fresh install or migration proces?. If you suggest migration process where can I get the documentation? 42:34 To get to WAS 8.0 from WAS 8.1, is this a migration process only? 42:57 What is the latest fix pack available on top of 8.5.5.0 base (and location to down load from Passport Advantage)? 43:37 Is there a fixed release scheduled for FixPacks? I hear that it's every 3 months or so. 44:24 If I have 1000 servers to apply FP, whats the recommended method to apply fixes to large number of servers in minimum time; any tools available? 47:01 I have IIM, WASND, WAS installed and configured per application's requirement. Now, I want to install another instance of WAS. Does IIM have an option to take the existing WAS as a template so that I can get the configuration also? 47:49 We are planning to upgrade from 6.1 to 8.5.5.0. What's the stable version (already being used by companies)? 48:45 Closing remarks 50:05 End of Call
    30→Panel of Experts: Jeanette Daly WebSphere Application Server L2 Support Mike Hill WebSphere Application Server L2 Support Vishavpal Shergill WebSphere Application Server L2 Support Vikram Thommandru WebSphere Application Server L2 Support
    31→

Right-click and select Save As to store the file on your local computer for later playback. Remember that you can fast forward to any question using the time index.

[ToolResultBlock(tool_use_id='tooluse_JxbckYUJH6RTSmpTkT3BCx', content='     1→---
     2→id: "edd5f9fc"
     3→title: "admin.passwd; index.html TECHNOTE (TROUBLESHOOTING)"
     4→source_repo: "rungalileo/ragbench"

     6→tags: [ragbench, techqa]
     7→confidence: medium
     8→---
     9→
    10→admin.passwd; index.html TECHNOTE (TROUBLESHOOTING)
    11→
    12→PROBLEM(ABSTRACT)
    13→ Use of Installation Manager (IM) to install IBM HTTP Server (IHS webserver) starts with IHS version 8.0.0.0. Prior to use of IM, the fixpacks for IHS (V7 and V6.x) did not include files expected to be customized such as default static content files like index.html and other HTML, GIF, and ICO files installed by IHS to its <IBM HTTP Server home>/htdocs directory. More importantly the admin.passwd file (that holds the user/passsword for the IHS Admin Service) is usually configured right after install when using the Plugin Configration Tool (PCT).
    14→
    15→Prior to use of IM you could not install directly to a fixpack level. You had to install the base GA code (i.e. 7.0.0.0 or 6.1.0.0) and then use the Update Installer to apply fixpacks. IM supports installation directly to a fixpack level therefore all install files included with the base GA code 8.0.0.0 are applied with the fixpack. Any files that should not be overwritten must be listed in a exception list (of non-serviceable files) that the IM installer can reference. This list of non-serviceable files was ommitted or incomplete for IHS V8.0.0.0 and 8.5.0.0 so the install of the first fixpack (regardless of fixpack level) may overwrite files such as admin.passwd and index.html.
    16→
    17→There are two APAR related to the same event:
    18→.
    19→PM71612: ADDITIONAL NON-SERVICEABLE FILES ADDED FOR IBM HTTP SERVER.
    20→http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg1PM71612 [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg1PM71612]
    21→.
    22→PM63634: IHS CONFIG ADMIN.PASSWD FILE WAS RESET AFTER INSTALLING
    23→FIXPACK 3 ON WAS 8.0.0.2 or 7.0.0.25 on Windows.
    24→http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg1PM63634 [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg1PM63634]
    25→
    26→.
    27→The technote about PM63634: IHS CONFIG ADMIN.PASSWD FILE WAS RESET advises a resolution in reseting the admin.passwd file:
    28→
    29→Installation of IBM HTTP Server 7.0.0.25, 8.0.0.1, 8.0.0.2, 8.0.0.3 will overlay admin.passwd:
    30→http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21593118 [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21593118]
    31→
    32→The main impact is that the IHS admin.passwd file gets overwritten which means the IHS Admin User/PW must be reset with the htpasswd utility in the IHS bin directory. Some customers customize the IHS splash page (index.html) or other default pages provided by IHS install so apply of first fixpack can overwrite these files and the customer's customization.
    33→
    34→The list of these non-serviceable files where included in 8.0.0.5 and 8.5.0.1 per the APAR links above so once that fixpack level is applied then any future fixpacks will not overwrite these files. There is no way to avoid the event if GA 8.0.0.0/8.5.0.0 IHS is installed first. The first fixpack applied (of any fixpack) could replace the files.
    35→
    36→This Technote defines three recommendations to avoid the problem.
    37→
    38→SYMPTOM
    39→- The admin.passwd is a zero byte file after apply of fixpack
    40→
    41→ - Any content installed under <IBM HTTP Server home>/htdocs by IHS install (default static content files) that have been customized are replaced by their default originals after apply of fixpack
    42→
    43→CAUSE
    44→Files not marked as non-serviceable files for IM install of fixpacks for IHS per APAR PM71612
    45→
    46→ENVIRONMENT
    47→WebSphere environments that use IHS v8.x to run the WSAS plugin for Webservers to act as proxy front to WSAS appservers.
    48→
    49→RESOLVING THE PROBLEM
    50→Support suggests one of three recommendations to avoid the problem:
    51→
    52→1. Use IM to install IHS at fixpack 8.0.0.5/8.5.0.1 or higher bypassing the install of 8.0.0.0/8.5.0.0
    53→
    54→2. Do not use PCT, configure IHS Admin or use htpasswd (or other customization/config) until after fixpack has been applied.
    55→
    56→3. If you have already installed 8.0.0.0 or 8.5.0.0 then before you apply your first IHS fixpack backup these files:
    57→
    58→- admin.passwd
    59→
    60→- all content under <IBM HTTP Server home>/htdocs
    61→
    62→
    63→
    64→PRODUCT ALIAS/SYNONYM
    65→ IHS

But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

query:
DFHAP1203I and DFHSR0601 with 0C1 in EQA10OSM after upgrading to CICS TS 5.2 Why is my CICS region failing during startup with message DFHAP1203I followed by DFHSR0601 after I upgraded to CICS Transaction Server for z/OS (CICS TS) V5.2? A system dump shows an abend 0C1 occurring in the Debug Tool for z/OS module EQA10OSM. 
I receive the following messages:
DFHAP1203I Language Environment is being initialized. 
DFHSR0601 Program interrupt occurred with system task III in control.
answer:
Based on the documents found, I have a direct match for your issue. The third document (907e9a49.md) describes exactly the problem you're experiencing.

---

## Answer

Your CICS region is failing during startup due to **a mismatch in z/OS levels between Language Environment modules** (CEECCICS and CEEPLPKA).

### Root Cause
When you upgraded to CICS TS V5.2, there is an inconsistency between the z/OS Language Environment modules in your library concatenations. The modules CEECCICS and CEEPLPKA are at different z/OS levels, causing the 0C1 abend during Language Environment initialization.

### Resolution
**Ensure that there is only one instance of CEEPLPKA and CEECCICS in your library concatenations, and that they are at the correct z/OS level.**

Specifically:
1. Check your STEPLIB and other library concatenations for duplicate copies of these modules
2. Verify that both CEEPLPKA and CEECCICS are from the same z/OS release
3. Remove any older versions that may be causing the mismatch

### Why This Happens
The messages you're seeing indicate:
- `DFHAP1203I` - Language Environment initialization is starting
- `DFHSR0601` - A program interrupt (0C1 abend) occurs in system task III during this initialization
- The 0C1 abend in EQA10OSM (Debug Tool module) is a symptom of the underlying Language Environment module mismatch

[来源: docs/ragbench-techqa/907e9a49.md > PROBLEM(ABSTRACT) / CAUSE / RESOLVING THE PROBLEM]

- The 0C1 abend in EQA10OSM (Debug Tool module) is a symptom of the underlying Language Environment module mismatch

messages.result:
Based on the documents found, I have a direct match for your issue. The third document (907e9a49.md) describes exactly the problem you're experiencing.

---

## Answer

Your CICS region is failing during startup due to **a mismatch in z/OS levels between Language Environment modules** (CEECCICS and CEEPLPKA).

### Root Cause
When you upgraded to CICS TS V5.2, there is an inconsistency between the z/OS Language Environment modules in your library concatenations. The modules CEECCICS and CEEPLPKA are at different z/OS levels, causing the 0C1 abend during Language Environment initialization.

### Resolution
**Ensure that there is only one instance of CEEPLPKA and CEECCICS in your library concatenations, and that they are at the correct z/OS level.**

Specifically:
1. Check your STEPLIB and other library concatenations for duplicate copies of these modules
2. Verify that both CEEPLPKA and CEECCICS are from the same z/OS release
3. Remove any older versions that may be causing the mismatch

### Why This Happens
The messages you're seeing indicate:
- `DFHAP1203I` - Language Environment initialization is starting
- `DFHSR0601` - A program interrupt (0C1 abend) occurs in system task III during this initialization
- The 0C1 abend in EQA10OSM (Debug Tool module) is a symptom of the underlying Language Environment module mismatch

[来源: docs/ragbench-techqa/907e9a49.md > PROBLEM(ABSTRACT) / CAUSE / RESOLVING THE PROBLEM]

We got a NullPointerException when bootstrapping the object store or accessing Site Preferences/Access Role on WorkplaceXT 

After logging into FileNet Workplace XT, a java.lang.NullPointerException error is logged when bootstrapping the object store or when accessing Site Preferences/Access Role.

Here's the error stack,

answer:
Perfect! I found the exact document that addresses this issue. The document `1730356f.md` matches the error stack trace precisely and provides the cause and resolution.

---

## Answer

This NullPointerException error in FileNet Workplace XT occurs due to an **invalid entry in the Directory Services Configuration**.

**Cause:**
The error happens when an invalid entry has been specified in the **User Display Name Attribute** or **Group Display Name Attribute** setting in the Directory Services Configuration in FileNet Enterprise Manager (FEM). Workplace XT attempts to resolve user names and groups defined within the Access Roles based on the Directory Service configuration. If the user name query resolves to null or contains an invalid entry, a NullPointerException occurs.

**Resolution:**
In FileNet Enterprise Manager (FEM), change the User Display Name Attribute or Group Display Name Attribute to a valid LDAP entry such as:
- `cn`
- `displayName` 
- `uid`

After making this change, restart the FileNet Content Engine and Workplace XT instances.

[来源: docs/ragbench-techqa/1730356f.md > CAUSE / RESOLVING THE PROBLEM]

[TextBlock(text='Perfect! I found the exact document that addresses this issue. The document `1730356f.md` matches the error stack trace precisely and provides the cause and resolution.

---

## Answer

This NullPointerException error in FileNet Workplace XT occurs due to an **invalid entry in the Directory Services Configuration**.

**Cause:**
The error happens when an invalid entry has been specified in the **User Display Name Attribute** or **Group Display Name Attribute** setting in the Directory Services Configuration in FileNet Enterprise Manager (FEM). Workplace XT attempts to resolve user names and groups defined within the Access Roles based on the Directory Service configuration. If the user name query resolves to null or contains an invalid entry, a NullPointerException occurs.

**Resolution:**
In FileNet Enterprise Manager (FEM), change the User Display Name Attribute or Group Display Name Attribute to a valid LDAP entry such as:
- `cn`
- `displayName` 
- `uid`

After making this change, restart the FileNet Content Engine and Workplace XT instances.

[来源: docs/ragbench-techqa/1730356f.md > CAUSE / RESOLVING THE PROBLEM]')]

messages.result:
Perfect! I found the exact document that addresses this issue. The document `1730356f.md` matches the error stack trace precisely and provides the cause and resolution.

---

## Answer

This NullPointerException error in FileNet Workplace XT occurs due to an **invalid entry in the Directory Services Configuration**.

**Cause:**
The error happens when an invalid entry has been specified in the **User Display Name Attribute** or **Group Display Name Attribute** setting in the Directory Services Configuration in FileNet Enterprise Manager (FEM). Workplace XT attempts to resolve user names and groups defined within the Access Roles based on the Directory Service configuration. If the user name query resolves to null or contains an invalid entry, a NullPointerException occurs.

**Resolution:**
In FileNet Enterprise Manager (FEM), change the User Display Name Attribute or Group Display Name Attribute to a valid LDAP entry such as:
- `cn`
- `displayName` 
- `uid`

After making this change, restart the FileNet Content Engine and Workplace XT instances.

[来源: docs/ragbench-techqa/1730356f.md > CAUSE / RESOLVING THE PROBLEM]

query:
Port number error starting 9.0 Launcher 

I'm attempting to start up v9.0 for the first time with one .msl file on a Windows server and get the following error.  I also have v8.4 on this server and it starts fine.  I do not have v8.4 running when I attempt to start v9.0.

Cannot recognize if the system RecordChangeSystem.msl; has started. Reason: Server is unable to get the status of the system on port number 6,002.

I have the port range set to 7000/8000.  Why am I seeing this?
answer:
Based on my search through the knowledge base, I found several documents related to WebSphere Transformation Extender (WTX) and IBM Integration Bus, but I did not find specific documentation addressing the exact error you're experiencing with the Launcher v9.0 and port number 6,002.

❌ **未找到相关文档。**

The knowledge base contains:
- General WTX documentation for versions 8.4.x (release notes, installation guides)
- IBM Integration Bus v9.0 documentation (but focused on security vulnerabilities and other issues)
- WebSphere Application Server port configuration guidance (but not specific to WTX Launcher)

⚠️ The documents mention WTX Launcher and port configuration concepts, but do not provide specific troubleshooting steps for the error message you're seeing: "Server is unable to get the status of the system on port number 6,002" when you have the port range set to 7000/8000.

**Possible reasons this might be happening** (based on general knowledge, not from the knowledge base):
- The system may be trying to use a hardcoded or previously configured port (6002) that conflicts with your port range setting (7000-8000)
- There may be a configuration file or registry setting that needs to be updated to reflect the new port range
- Version 9.0 may have different port configuration requirements compared to 8.4

For detailed troubleshooting of this specific WTX Launcher 9.0 port configuration issue, I recommend consulting the official IBM WebSphere Transformation Extender v9.0 documentation or contacting IBM support.

    47→
    48→- You need to have a file system with 200MB of free space to contain the fix files.
    49→Ensure that you have the free space required to install the fix.
    50→
    51→- If you already have an FTM product installed and have obtained special fixes, contact IBM(R) support to determine whether you need an updated version of the fixes before you install FTM v3.0.0.7.
    52→This helps to ensure that your system is in a consistent state and that no special fixes are lost. back to Contents
    53→
    54→What's new in FTM 3.0.0.7  * Extended Resend Support Enhancements have been made to the resend capabilities of transactions / transmissions, especially in the context of optimization settings where the logging of some objects may be avoided.
    55→ * Support for Devolved Timeout Alerts Enhancements have been made to the Outbound Transactions FSM to reduce the number of objects in a timed-out alert state.
    56→ * Refactoring of the Outbound Transaction FSM The Outbound Transaction FSM diagram has been split into 3 smaller diagrams in the interest of legibility. These diagrams include the Outbound Transaction, Outbound Transaction(Timeout) & Outbound Transaction(Devolved).
    57→ * Generation of Subflow and ESQL templates. Support has been added to the Model Tooling component to enable the generation of ESQL and Subflow files from an FTM model.
    58→ * Finer support for control of rollback on an Inbound Mapper abort. Support has been added at the interface(Channel) level to control rollback in the event of an Inbound Mapper abort.
    59→ * The Purge Utility has been enhanced.
    60→
    61→See the "Financial Transaction Manager -> Financial Transaction Manager overview -> What's new in FTM" section of the "FTM for z/OS v3.0.0 Knowledge Center" available at
    62→IBM Financial Transaction Manager for z/OS V3.0.0 documentation [https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSRH32_3.0.0/SSRH32_3.0.0welcome.html]
    63→back to Contents
    64→
    65→Known issues
    66→Issue 1 Summary :
    67→
    68→Customers using IBM WebSphere Transformation Extender(WTX) version 8.4.1.2 who use native schema and choice sequence iterations are unable to access iterations of a particular sequence group.
    69→
    70→Resolution :
    71→
    72→The fix for this issue (APAR PI31636) is available in WTX v8.4.1.3.
    73→
    74→Issue 2
    75→
    76→Summary :
    77→
    78→Customers using IBM Integration Bus (IIB) version 9.0.0.x may experience the following BIP2930E error when deploying or restarting the broker.
    79→
    80→RecoverableException BIP2930E: A function or procedure was called but the value supplied for the ''cAppVer'' parameter was of type ''BOOLEAN'' but the function/procedure expects value of type ''CHARACTER'' Functions and procedures require an exact matching between the data type of values supplied as parameters and the data type in its definition.
    81→
    82→Resolution :
    83→
    84→The fix for this issue (IIB APAR IT06286) is available in IIB Maintenance Level 9.0.0.4.
    85→
    86→Issue 3
    87→
    88→Summary :
    89→
    90→Customers using IBM Integration Bus (IIB) version 9.0.0.3 may experience the following BIP2503E when executing customer flows if propagating from a node after exiting a FOR loop acting on a shared variable.
    91→
    92→RecoverableException BIP2503E: Propagate with a SHARED variable lock held by FOR statement.
    93→
    94→Resolution :
    95→
    96→The fix for this issue (IIB APAR IT07974) is available in IIB Maintenance Level 9.0.0.4.
    97→
    98→Issue 4
    99→
   100→Summary :
   101→
   102→Customers using IBM Integration Bus (IIB) version 9.0.0.5 may experience the following issue:
   103→
   104→If a user has a REFERENCE variable declared at the module or schema level which points at either OutputRoot, OutputLocalEnvironment or OutputExceptionList and performs a PROPAGATE without specifying DELETE NONE in a compute node then it is not defined what the REFERENCE variable will be left pointing at. After the PROPAGATE the Output trees are deleted and the REFERENCE variables should be reset to point at the root of the newly created trees.The module and schema level reference variables are not being reset and are thus left to point at the original syntax element which they were pointing at which will now have been reset leading to unexpected results.
   105→
   106→Resolution :
   107→
   108→The fix for this issue (IIB APAR IT14426) is available in IIB Maintenance Level 9.0.0.6.
   109→
   110→Issue 5
   111→
   112→Summary :
   113→
   114→Customers using any Broker level from v7.x may experience inconsistent validation results when using FTM Channel based validation and/or IIB in ESQL parser validation.
   115→
   116→Resolution :
   117→
   118→IIB APAR IT14075 has been raised for this issue.
   119→
   120→Issue 6
   121→
   122→Summary :
   123→
   124→FTM SWIFT SR2016 WTX maps will not work with FTM SWIFT SR2015 WTX maps at a single broker instance together at the same time.
   125→
   126→The reason is that IBM Transformation Extender has changed the JVCWrapper code with the new Financial Payments Pack for SWIFT 9.0.1 release and it is not compatible with the earlier Pack for SWIFT releases.
   127→Therefore using multiple Pack for SWIFT versions at the same time in a specific instance of a program is not supported.
   128→
   129→Issue 8
   130→
   131→Summary :
   132→
   133→Debulking and Bulking Sample application :
   134→
   135→If the FTM database timezone is set to UTC and the runtime (IIB/Broker) timezone it set to a different timezone then bulking will not occur(ref:55056).
   136→

   138→

   140→readme file was downloaded: http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg22002334 [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg22002334]
   141→
   142→Use the normal SMP/E process to install this PTF.
   143→

   145→

   148→
   149→Follow the instructions in the "Financial Transaction Manager -> Planning -> Migration" section of the "FTM for z/OS v3.0.0 Knowledge Center" available at
   150→IBM Financial Transaction Manager for z/OS V3.0.0 documentation [https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSRH32_3.0.0/SSRH32_3.0.0welcome.html] back to Contents
   151→

    10→WTX; TX TECHNOTE (FAQ)
    11→
    12→QUESTION
    13→ What directories does the WTX Map Primitive use in IBM® WebSphere® Transformation Extender for WebSphere Enterprise Service Bus?
    14→
    15→ANSWER
    16→For maps that are
    17→
    18→ * Specified by Use map from project setting
    19→ * Set in the service message object (SMO) mapServerLocation property
    20→ * Set in the SMO and overridden at runtime
    21→
    22→The home directory is:
    23→
    24→< WESBserver >/temp/WTX/< flowName >/< mediationName >
    25→
    26→where < WESBserver> is the server name under the profiles directory in the WebSphere Enterprise Service Bus or WebSphere Process Server installation location.
    27→
    28→The directory of the WebSphere Transformation Extender map's default audit log, trace log, and workspace is
    29→
    30→< WESBserver >/logs/WTX/< flowName >/< mediationName >

[ToolResultBlock(tool_use_id='tooluse_iu3rbLL8ge0bsri0zwHAjR', content='     1→---
     2→id: "a00112ca"
     3→title: "DTXINST; Integration Server; WESB; Install; prerequiste TECHNOTE (TROUBLESHOOTIN"
     4→source_repo: "rungalileo/ragbench"

     8→---
     9→
    10→DTXINST; Integration Server; WESB; Install; prerequiste TECHNOTE (TROUBLESHOOTING)
    11→
    12→PROBLEM(ABSTRACT)
    13→ When attempting to install WebSphere® Transformation Extender for Integration Server version 8.2.0.x, to a server on which WebSphere Enterprise Service Bus has already been successfully installed, the Integration Server install fails with a "Setup has detected that you are trying to install a product that requires an IBM WebSphere Integration Server as a prerequisite." error message
    14→
    15→CAUSE
    16→The WebSphere Transformation Extender for Integration Servers install process cannot locate a keyword in the .nifregistry file
    17→
    18→ENVIRONMENT
    19→During the installation of WebSphere Transformation Extender for Integration Servers v8.2.0.x
    20→
    21→DIAGNOSING THE PROBLEM
    22→An error message, "Setup has detected that you are trying to install a product that requires an IBM WebSphere Integration Server as a prerequisite." will be displayed.
    23→
    24→RESOLVING THE PROBLEM
    25→The following steps can be taken to edit the .nifregistry file to resolve this installation issue:
    26→
    27→Operating System root installed .nifregistry location Windows %SystemRoot% AIX /usr/.ibm/.nif Solaris, Linux, HP-UX /opt/.ibm/.nif Operating System non-root installed .nifregistry location AIX, Solaris, Linux, HP-UX ~/.nif
    28→
    29→1) Open the .nifregistry file with a file editor of your choice. The .nifregistry file is located in the directory depicted in the table listed above.
    30→
    31→2) Look for a line similar to the following that contains "WebSphere/ESB/":
    32→
    33→<product installrooturi=" file:///C:/Program%20Files/IBM/WebSphere/ESB/ [file:///C:/Program%20Files/IBM/WebSphere/ESB/]"
    34→lastvisited="2008-07-16 14:17:00-0400" productid="ND" version="6.1.0.17"/>
    35→
    36→3) Change the productid to be WBI.
    37→
    38→4) After editing the .nifregistry file, the line should now look like:
    39→<product installrooturi=" file:///C:/Program%20Files/IBM/WebSphere/ESB/ [file:///C:/Program%20Files/IBM/WebSphere/ESB/]"
    40→lastvisited="2008-07-16 14:17:00-0400" productid="WBI" version="6.1.0.17"/>
    41→
    42→Your version of WBI may be different, but as long as it is a 6.1.0.x release, it is relative to this Technote.
    43→
    44→5) Install the WebSphere Transformation Extender for Integration Server software.
    45→
    46→6) After the install is complete, restore the productid to "ND" in the .nifregistry file.
    47→
    48→The .nifregistry file may have slightly different values in it, the key is to modify just the productid.
    49→
    50→PRODUCT ALIAS/SYNONYM
    51→ WTX Integration Server
    52→Ascential DataStage TX

     2→id: "c69ab58f"
     3→title: "security; administration; xmlaccess; password; change; spyware; malware; adware;"
     4→source_repo: "rungalileo/ragbench"

     8→---
     9→
    10→security; administration; xmlaccess; password; change; spyware; malware; adware; LDAP; realm; releasebuilder; standalone; federated TECHNOTE (FAQ)
    11→
    12→QUESTION
    13→Top Content for WebSphere Portal Security and Administration, all topics.
    14→
    15→ANSWER
    16→1. What steps should I follow to change Portal-related passwords?
    17→The WebSphere Portal documentation contains instructions for both Version 6.1 [http://publib.boulder.ibm.com/infocenter/wpdoc/v6r1/topic/com.ibm.wp.ent.doc_v615/security/sec_pswds.html] and [http://www-10.lotus.com/ldd/portalwiki.nsf/dx/Updating_user_ID_and_passwords_wp7]Version 7 [http://www-10.lotus.com/ldd/portalwiki.nsf/dx/Updating_user_ID_and_passwords_wp7].
    18→
    19→2. How can I configure LDAP failover in WebSphere Portal?
    20→
    21→See Implementing LDAP failover [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21382720].
    22→
    23→3. Login fails for a single user or a small number of users and only on specific workstations. What might cause this?
    24→
    25→Client add-ons could prevent successful login [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21441915]
    26→
    27→4. After login a single image file is shown in the browser and nothing else, how can I resolve this?
    28→
    29→Apply APAR PM25450 [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg1PM25450] then perform the manual configuration steps listed in the APAR text.
    30→
    31→5. Should I configure the Portal for standalone or federated LDAP security?
    32→
    33→Federated security is the out-of-the-box configuration. The configuration task wp-modify-ldap-security "converts" the configuration to standalone with a single LDAP. Use standalone if you: (1) Will not require more than one LDAP or another type user repository (for example, a database), (2) Will not need to configure multiple virtual portals, each with its own realm.
    34→
    35→6. Is my current security configuration is standalone or federated?
    36→
    37→Determining whether WebSphere Portal security configuration is standalone or federated [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21386736]
    38→
    39→7. Configuration changes in our environment have caused access to Portal artifacts to be lost. How can I restore access?
    40→
    41→See How to fix Portal Access Control settings after user/group external identifiers have changed [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21377025]
    42→
    43→8. In our environment, updates are made to LDAP directly outside Portal. The changes are not immediately visible in the Portal or in our custom portlet. Why is this?
    44→
    45→Both the Portal User Management Architecture (PUMA) and WebSphere Application Server Virtual Member Manager (VMM) component maintain caches that are automatically updated only if user, group or attribute changes are made using the Portal UI.
    46→
    47→You can adjust the cache time [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21413947] out periods, disable the caches [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21379992] (this is to be avoided due to its effect on performance), or, if you have custom code that calls or can be modified to call the PUMA reload() method, apply APAR PM16430 [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg1PM16430] and add the associated new properties.
    48→
    49→9. Is there a document that summarizes the ReleaseBuilder tool?
    50→
    51→Yes. See Using ReleaseBuilder effectively [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21243005]
    52→
    53→10. How do I collect log files or trace for a WebSphere Portal security issue?
    54→
    55→Follow the appropriate Collecting Data [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21312740] document for the version of Portal in use.

    41→   * USERS AFFECTED:  This APAR provides a cumulative list of     *
    42→   *                  the documentation issues for month_year     *
    43→   *                  that affect users of IBM WebSphere          *
    44→   *                  Application Server Version 8.5.             *
    45→   ****************************************************************
    46→   * PROBLEM DESCRIPTION: The Knowledge Centers for WebSphere     *
    47→   *                      Application Server Version 8.5 need     *
    48→   *                      to reflect customer enhancement         *
    49→   *                      requests received in problem            *
    50→   *                      management records (PMRs). These        *
    51→   *                      enhancements can include fixing         *
    52→   *                      technical inaccuracies or clarifying    *
    53→   *                      vague information.                      *
    54→   ****************************************************************
    55→   * RECOMMENDATION:                                              *
    56→   ****************************************************************
    57→   See the Problem conclusion section for a description of the
    58→   issues, which are described in customer PMRs, and the
    59→   documentation change or changes that will address these issues.
    60→
    61→
    62→
    63→
    64→
    65→
    66→PROBLEM CONCLUSION
    67→ *  Note: We update our knowledge centers monthly. The following
    68→   Version 8.5 modifications will be available in the month_year
    69→   update to the Knowledge Centers. To access the latest
    70→   on-line documentation, go to the product library page at
    71→   http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/library and
    72→   select the version and product that is appropriate for your
    73→   WebSphere Application Server environment.
    74→   --------
    75→   ID: PI58314
    76→   Problem: To avoid fewer pmrs where customers using 3rd party
    77→   JPA jars and getting the problems. Need to add a statement in
    78→   knowledge center so that we can also avoid sending these pmrs .
    79→
    80→   Resolution: Topic, Using third-party persistence providers, is
    81→   updated as follows:
    82→   Add an AVOID TROUBLE note that says:
    83→   Avoid trouble: Even though IBM supports the enablement of
    84→   third party JPA run times to run on WebSphere Application
    85→   Server, and ensures the successful deployment of applications
    86→   that use such run times,IBM does not provide support for
    87→   resolving JAR file conflict problems, or any problem that a
    88→   stack trace indicates is in the third party code.
    89→
    90→   The update also applies to V9.0
    91→   ----------
    92→   ID: 772810
    93→   Problem: Calling getResource that begin with a forward slash
    94→   (/) may return NULL if the JVM custom property
    95→   com.ibm.ws.classloader.strict is set to true.  This condition
    96→   needs to be pointed out in the knowledge
    97→   center.
    98→
    99→   Resolution: Topic, Java virtual machine custom properties, is
   100→   updated for the com.ibm.ws.classloader.strict property with an
   101→   Important note that reads:
   102→
   103→   Important: Ensure that you use the resources that don't begin
   104→   with a forward slash (/). The WebSphere Application Server
   105→   class loader behaves consistently with the Java Underclassman
   106→   by using this property, which prohibits getResource calls that
   107→   begin with a forward slash (/).
   108→
   109→   The update also applies to V7.0, V8.0, and, V9.0
   110→   -------------
   111→   ID: 772705
   112→   Problem: In the following WAS 8.5.5 documentation we read
   113→   about "Memory overload protection" that should be disabled by
   114→   default:
   115→   Topic: Configuring memory overload protection
   116→   During a test a javacore was produced in which it seems the
   117→   libHeapDetect64.so is loaded despite the fact no "-agentlib"
   118→   parameter was specified. The documentation needs to clarify
   119→   this condition.
   120→
   121→   Resolution: Topic, Configuring memory overload protection, is
   122→   updated as follows:
   123→   (1)AVOID TROUBLE note before the procedure now reads:
   124→   Avoid trouble: To ensure that the memory overload protection
   125→   is configured properly, the -agentlib parameter needs to be
   126→   set in the Generic JVM arguments field. Specifying the
   127→   -agentlib parameter is only required in WebSphere ??Applicatio
   128→   Server Version 8.5.5.2 and earlier. For a version of WebSphere
   129→   Application Server after version 8.5.5.2, the -agentlib
   130→   parameter is always loaded and does not need to be set, even
   131→   if the autonomic request flow manager (ARFM) is disabled.
   132→
   133→   (2) the sentence just before this AVOID TROUBLE note is
   134→   rewritten to read:
   135→   Memory overload protection is disabled by default. Memory
   136→   overload protection is enabled when the memory overload
   137→   protection (MOP) value is set to less than 100.
   138→
   139→   The update also applies to V9.0
   140→   -----------
   141→   209287 (RTC)
   142→   Problem: Client had issue setting the startup wait time.
   143→   PM91596 [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg1PM91596] added a new bootstrap.properties parameter:
   144→   server.start.wait.time
   145→   This bootstrap.properties parameter is not
   146→   documented in the Knowledge Center and should be
   147→
   148→   Resolution: Topic, Specifying Liberty bootstrap properties, is
   149→   updated to read:
   150→   Use custom properties to configure server start wait time.
   151→
   152→   You can increase the server start wait time beyond the product
   153→   default setting by adding the server.start.wait.time property
   154→   to the boostrap.properties file. The server.start.wait.time is
   155→   specified in seconds.
   156→
   157→       Specify the server.start.wait.time property in the
   158→   bootstrap.properties file. The following example sets the
   159→   server start time to 25 seconds.
   160→
   161→       server.start.wait.time = 25
   162→
   163→       This setting means that as the server starts, the
   164→   reporting mechanism for the server attempts to report on the
   165→   completed stages of the start. If the reporting mechanism for
   166→   the server cannot perform its function within 25 seconds, an
   167→   error 22 occurs.
   168→
   169→       If you do not add the server.start.wait.time property to
   170→   the bootstrap.properties file, the default server start wait
   171→   time is internally set to 30 seconds.
   172→
   173→   This update also applies to V9.0
   174→   -----------
   175→   ID: 772734
   176→   Problem:Topic, Configuring port settings, is missing
   177→   information about configuring to set port numbers in a
   178→   different port range so that they cannot conflict.
   179→   Resolution: Topic, Configuring port settings, is update to add
   180→   a third optional step that reads:
   181→   Optional: Set port numbers in a different port range so that
   182→   they cannot conflict.
   183→
   184→   WebSphere Application Server cannot always detect port
   185→   conflicts when multiple installations are present on multiple
   186→   hosts. To set port numbers in this situation so that you avoid
   187→   port conflicts, adjust the starting port numbers of each
   188→   installation to be in a different range from the other
   189→   installations.
   190→
   191→   For example, in a system with two installations, you can
   192→   configure one installation to use the default port number
   193→   settings, and manually assign a different port range in the
   194→   second installation.
   195→
   196→       Create the deployment manager of the second installation
   197→   by using the manageprofiles command. On the -startingPort
   198→   option, set a starting port number that is out of range of any
   199→   ports that other installations use.
   200→
   201→       bin/manageprofiles.sh -create -profileName Dmgr03
   202→   -profilePath
   203→       /opt/IBM/WebSphere/AppServer_2/profiles/Dmgr03 -templatePath
   204→       /opt/IBM/WebSphere/AppServer_2/profileTemplates/management
   205→   -startingPort 15000
   206→
   207→       Create the application server or custom profiles on each
   208→   target machine.
   209→       Federate the profiles to the deployment manager by running
   210→   the addNode command.
   211→       Create clusters and cluster members from the deployment
   212→   manager.
   213→
   214→       New servers that you create inherit the higher starting
   215→   port number from the deployment manager.
   216→       Note: Node agents do not inherit the starting port number
   217→   from the deployment manager. If needed, manually change the
   218→   port number settings.
   219→
   220→   Tip: You can use the Profile Port Checker tool to check for
   221→   conflicts without needing to start the servers. Note that the
   222→   tool checks only for conflicts on the machine where it runs.
   223→   For information about using the Profile Port Checker, see
   224→   Using the Profile Port Checker.
   225→
   226→   This update also applies to V9.0

[ToolResultBlock(tool_use_id='tooluse_KUB7Q7Oz7FaEnobqoiAMc2', content='     1→---

     9→
    10→Messaging bindings troubleshooting tips; messaging bindings TECHNOTE (TROUBLESHOOTING)
    11→
    12→PROBLEM(ABSTRACT)
    13→ This document contains common questions and answers that are related to Messaging bindings.
    14→
    15→RESOLVING THE PROBLEM
    16→
    17→TAB NAVIGATION
    18→ * Learn more [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21405260]
    19→ * Troubleshoot [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21405299]- selected tab,
    20→ * Collect data [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21268195]
    21→
    22→Table of contents
    23→Troubleshooting Messaging bindings problems
    24→
    25→1 . What traces are required for troubleshooting bindings problems?
    26→2. Where can I find the changes made in my WebSphere MQ header fields in Service Message Objects(SMO) reflected in the outbound WebSphere MQ message?
    27→
    28→3. I am receiving the exception below, what custom properties do I need to define?
    29→com.ibm.websphere.sca.ServiceRuntimeException: MQ channel exit has not been invoked, ensure Connection Factory has Custom Properties set for exits.
    30→
    31→4. Can two WebSphere MQ exports or imports point to the same queue?
    32→
    33→5. If the WebSphere MQ goes down, would the listener port re-connect to the WebSphere MQ automatically when it is available again?
    34→
    35→6. How can I dynamically change the JNDI resources for a WebSphere MQ import without the need to re-deploy the application?
    36→
    37→7. I am seeing the exception below, what does this mean?
    38→com.ibm.websphere.sca.ServiceRuntimeException: No message is received from callback queue with selector=callbackID='CALLBACKMESSAGE_ID:....
    39→
    40→8. Even though I have received a response for a request that was sent out, I see the error message below. Why am I seeing this error and what are the possible solutions?
    41→com.ibm.websphere.sca.ServiceRuntimeException: No message is received from callback queue with selector=callbackID='CALLBACKMESSAGE_ID:...
    42→
    43→9. My listener port is stopping due to an invalid or “bad” message and further processing does not take place. How do I configure the listener port to not stop and continue processing?
    44→
    45→WebSphere Process Server Messaging Bindings Questions and Answers
    46→1. What traces are required for troubleshooting bindings?
    47→For all messaging bindings, use the following trace setting: SCA.JMS=all
    48→
    49→Back to top
    50→
    51→2. Where can I find the changes made in some of the WebSphere MQ headers fields in SMO reflected in the outbound WebSphere MQ message?
    52→
    53→Not all fields are propagated in the outbound message. You can find a list of the fields that are not passed on in the Using WebSphere MQ bindings in WebSphere ESB, Part 1: Manipulating MQ headers in WebSphere ESB using the XSL transformation primitive and WebSphere Integration Developer [http://www.ibm.com/developerworks/websphere/library/techarticles/0901_norton1/0901_norton1.html] developerWorks article.
    54→
    55→Back to top
    56→
    57→3. I am receiving the exception below, what custom properties do I need to define?
    58→com.ibm.websphere.sca.ServiceRuntimeException: MQ channel exit has not been invoked, ensure Connection Factory has Custom Properties set for exits.
    59→
    60→Refer to the Service Component Architecture modules and WebSphere MQ [http://publib.boulder.ibm.com/infocenter/dmndhelp/v6r1mx/index.jsp?topic=/com.ibm.websphere.soacore.612.doc/doc/cadm_scaandwmq.html] information center topic, which discusses the custom properties that you need to set. [http://publib.boulder.ibm.com/infocenter/dmndhelp/v6r1mx/index.jsp?topic=/com.ibm.websphere.soacore.612.doc/doc/cadm_scaandwmq.html]
    61→
    62→You can find information on channel exits in the Using the WebSphere MQ messaging provider in WebSphere Application Server V7, Part 2: Using channel exits [http://www.ibm.com/developerworks/websphere/techjournal/0906_leming/0906_leming.html] developerWorks article. [http://www.ibm.com/developerworks/websphere/techjournal/0906_leming/0906_leming.html]
    63→
    64→Back to top
    65→
    66→4. Can two WebSphere MQ exports or imports point to the same queue?
    67→
    68→Multiple imports or exports (or applications) using the same queue is not supported. It cannot be guaranteed which one would receive the response. There should be separate queues for each import and export.
    69→
    70→One Import/Export per MQ queue configuration is required. This configuration is also true in a golden or silver topology cluster environment. In this environment, the callback queue for the Import is remote from the application and all cluster members have visibility of the callback information.
    71→
    72→Back to top
    73→
    74→5. If WebSphere MQ goes down, would the listener port re-connect to WebSphere MQ automatically when it is available again?
    75→
    76→If a WebSphere MQ resource goes down within the retry limits (the default is 5 times) then the listeners will reconnect. For example, if you try to put a message once and WebSphere MQ has gone down but then comes up on the 2nd, 3rd or 4th retry, it should reconnect. However, if the retry limit has been reached then after the listeners finish retrying, they are stopped and need to be started again manually.
    77→Back to top
    78→
    79→6. How can I dynamically change the JNDI resources for a WebSphere MQ import without the need to re-deploy the application?
    80→
    81→Follow the below steps:
    82→
    83→ 1. Log into the administrative console.
    84→
    85→
    86→ 2. Expand the Applications section.
    87→
    88→
    89→ 3. Select SCA modules.
    90→
    91→
    92→ 4. Select your module in question.
    93→
    94→
    95→ 5. On the right side of the page, expand imports, find the import you are referring to and select it.
    96→
    97→
    98→ 6. Expand 'Bindings'.
    99→
   100→
   101→ 7. Click MQ.
   102→
   103→
   104→ 8. Make changes to the JNDI and click apply.
   105→
   106→
   107→ 9. Save.
   108→    Back to top
   109→
   110→
   111→
   112→
   113→7. I am seeing the below exception, what does it mean?
   114→com.ibm.websphere.sca.ServiceRuntimeException: No message is received from callback queue with
   115→selector=callbackID='CALLBACKMESSAGE_ID:....
   116→
   117→The previous exception means that an MQ import is receiving a response message for a request that it did not send a request message for.
   118→Back to top
   119→
   120→8. Even though I have received a response for a request that was sent out, I see the error message below. Why am I seeing this error and what are the possible solutions?
   121→com.ibm.websphere.sca.ServiceRuntimeException: No message is received from callback queue with selector=callbackID='CALLBACKMESSAGE_ID:....
   122→
   123→See the following process that explains how the MQ/JMS Import works:
   124→
   125→ 1. MQ/JMS Import sends the MQ/JMS Request message and in the same transaction it also puts a correlation message to a Service Integration Bus (SIBus) Queue.
   126→
   127→
   128→ 2. MQ/JMS Import response listener receives the MQ/JMS response message off the response queue and, at this point, it attempts to get the correlation message off the SIBus queue.
   129→
   130→
   131→ 3. The response listener waits for a maximum of 6 seconds for the correlation message to become available before throwing the exception that you see.
   132→
   133→
   134→ 4. The MQ/JMS response message is then subject to the MQ retry and backout configuration as you have defined.
   135→
   136→Therefore, a possible cause for this error is a delay in the SIBus message being committed and becoming available. This scenario might be caused by performance issues of the underlying database used by SIBus.
   137→
   138→To handle such situations you have the following options:
   139→ 1. For the MQ/JMS Import, JMS callback destination has the default of persistence (Application). The MQ/JMS Import sends the correlation message as PERSISTENT; therefore, the message is persistent.
   140→
   141→
   142→    MQ/JMS Callback Connection Factory uses the default Quality of Service for persistent, so it maps persistent to "Reliable Persistence" for SIBus.
   143→
   144→
   145→    You can try changing this to "Assured Persistent," which drives the persistence of the message on the same thread as the commit call.
   146→
   147→
   148→ 2. Increase the retry values on the WebSphere MQ backout threshold and listener port to optimum values. In this case, the message is tried more than once before being sent to the backout queue.
   149→
   150→
   151→ 3. Tune the database used by SIBus to avoid any performance issue.
   152→    Back to top
   153→
   154→
   155→
   156→
   157→9. My listener port is stopping due to an invalid or “bad” message and further processing does not take place. How do I configure the listener port to not stop and continue processing?
   158→
   159→These messages are known as poison messages. Refer to the How WebSphere Application Server V6 handles poison messages [http://www.ibm.com/developerworks/websphere/library/techarticles/0803_titheridge/0803_titheridge.html] developerWorks article, which discusses how to handle these messages [http://www.ibm.com/developerworks/websphere/library/techarticles/0803_titheridge/0803_titheridge.html].
   160→Back to top

❌ **未找到相关文档。**

The knowledge base contains:
- General WTX documentation for versions 8.4.x (release notes, installation guides)
- IBM Integration Bus v9.0 documentation (but focused on security vulnerabilities and other issues)
- WebSphere Application Server port configuration guidance (but not specific to WTX Launcher)

⚠️ The documents mention WTX Launcher and port configuration concepts, but do not provide specific troubleshooting steps for the error message you're seeing: "Server is unable to get the status of the system on port number 6,002" when you have the port range set to 7000/8000.

**Possible reasons this might be happening** (based on general knowledge, not from the knowledge base):
- The system may be trying to use a hardcoded or previously configured port (6002) that conflicts with your port range setting (7000-8000)
